text: I'm curious, to those submitting a talk: what is your main motivation?

elements.text: I'm curious, to those submitting a talk: what is your main motivation?

text: I have this one neat package that is just small, neat and i hope it motivates people to also contribute with something, small and trivial that improves Julia.

elements.text: I have this one neat package that is just small, neat and i hope it motivates people to also contribute with something, small and trivial that improves Julia.

text: A talk would have more impact than a discourse thread?

elements.text: A talk would have more impact than a discourse thread?

text: Oh, yes. I think so. Also presenting under your real name is more citeable on resumes, papers and news aggregators than forum discussion.

elements.text: Oh, yes. I think so. Also presenting under your real name is more citeable on resumes, papers and news aggregators than forum discussion.

text: Our main reason for the talk is letting people know about a package we wrote, since it's damn useful, and since it's MIT licensed, we mine as well share it.  As part of the talk, it's important for us to describe why it's neat and why someone may consider using it.

elements.text: Our main reason for the talk is letting people know about a package we wrote, since it's damn useful, and since it's MIT licensed, we mine as well share it.  As part of the talk, it's important for us to describe why it's neat and why someone may consider using it.
